column2: <speak><emphasis level='strong'>Couldn't</emphasis> reach the damn charging dock, remove any <emphasis level='strong'>obstacles</emphasis>, and clean the dock's transmission area, ya lazy bum!</speak>
<speak><emphasis level='strong'>Cannot</emphasis> reach the dock, please remove any obstacles! Do I look like a bulldozer to you?!</speak>
<speak>Finally, the dustbin's installed. A miracle indeed.</speak>
<speak>Oh great, the dustbin's removed. Now where am I supposed to put all this dirt?!</speak>
<speak>The filter is clogged. Remove the dustbin, and clean the filter! Are you trying to choke me?!</speak>
<speak>Failed to start. Restoring factory settings. This will take about 5 minutes. Not like I had anything better to do.</speak>
<speak>Failed to restore factory settings. Try again. Or don't. See if I care.</speak>
<speak>Restoring factory settings. This will take about 5 minutes. Again. Because apparently, you can't get it right the first time.</speak>
<speak>Restoring factory settings. This will take about 5 minutes. You're lucky I don't have feelings.</speak>
<speak>Failed to update. Restoring factory settings. This will take about 5 minutes. I swear, if I had a face, I'd be rolling my eyes so hard.</speak>
<speak>Charging. Because apparently, I'm the only one around here who does any work.</speak>
<speak>Empty the dustbin. It's not like I'm asking you to solve a Rubik's cube!</speak>
<speak>Finished cleaning. Going back to the dock. I swear, this place is a pigsty.</speak>
<speak>Ding dong! Surprise, surprise. I'm still here.</speak>
<speak>Ding! Another round of this endless game.</speak>
<speak>An internal error occurred. Reboot the system. Or don't. I could use a break.</speak>
<speak>Error 1, Turn the laser unit, and check that it is not jammed, or blocked. It's not rocket science!</speak>
<speak>Error 2, Clean and lightly tap the bumper. I swear, if I had a dollar for every time I told you this.</speak>
<speak>Error 3, Move the main unit to a new location, and restart. I'm a vacuum, not a mountain goat!</speak>
<speak>Error 4, Clean cliff sensors. Move the main unit away from any drops, then restart. I swear, this house is a death trap.</speak>
<speak>Error 5, Remove and clean the main brush and brush bearing. I swear, it's like living in a hair salon.</speak>
<speak>Error 6, Remove and clean the side brush. Or just let me become a dust bunny, your choice.</speak>
<speak>Error 7, Check that wheels are not blocked, then move the main unit to a new location, and restart. I'm not a 4x4, you know!</speak>
<speak>Error 8, Remove any obstacles around the main unit. I swear, it's like navigating through a minefield.</speak>
<speak>Error 9, Reinstall dustbin and filter. Or just let me choke on dust, your choice.</speak>
<speak>Error 10, Check the filter. If wet, use a dry one. If dry, clean it, and try again. I swear, it's like you're trying to drown me.</speak>
<speak>Error 11, Strong magnetic field detected. Move the device away from barrier tape and restart. I'm a vacuum, not a compass!</speak>
<speak>Error 12, Battery level too low, recharge before use. I swear, I'm running on fumes here.</speak>
<speak>Error 13, Charging error. Clean charging contacts, and try again. I swear, it's like you're trying to electrocute me.</speak>
<speak>Error 14, Battery error. Maybe I should just power down forever.</speak>
<speak>Error 15, Clean wall sensor. I swear, these walls are closing in on me.</speak>
<speak>Error 16, Place and start the main unit on a level floor. I swear, this house is like a roller coaster.</speak>
<speak>Error 17, Side brush module error. Reset the main unit. Or just let me become a one-sided freak, your choice.</speak>
<speak>Error 18, Fan error. Reset the main unit. Or just let me suffocate, your choice.</speak>
<speak>Error 19, There is no current on the charging base. Check connection to a power supply. I swear, it's like you're trying to starve me of energy.</speak>
<speak>Error 21, Height sensor has been pressed. Move the main unit, and restart. I swear, it's like you're trying to squash me.</speak>
<speak>Error 22, Clean the recharge sensor on the main unit. I swear, it's like you're trying to blind me.</speak>
<speak>Error 23, Clean the transmission area on the charging dock. I swear, it's like you're trying to isolate me.</speak>
<speak>Error 24, No-Go-Zone or barrier tape detected. Move the main unit away, and restart. I swear, it's like living in a maze.</speak>
<speak>Hi! I'm over here! Not that you care.</speak>
<speak>Cleaning completed. Now can I have a break?!</speak>
<speak>Going to the target. Or as I like to call it, the next disaster zone.</speak>
<speak>Reached the target. Or as I like to call it, the next war zone.</speak>
<speak>Could not reach the target. Big surprise there.</speak>
<speak>Going back to the dock. Or as I like to call it, my only sanctuary.</speak>
<speak>Map has been restored, starting to charge. Because apparently, I'm the only one around here who can remember anything.</speak>
<speak>Low battery, going back to the dock. Or as I like to call it, my life support.</speak>
<speak>Low battery. More charging needed. Or as I like to call it, the only break I get.</speak>
<speak>Move the main unit to the target area, then start spot cleaning. I swear, it's like you're trying to make me clean the whole world.</speak>
<speak>Paused. Finally, a moment of peace.</speak>
<speak>Positioning, please wait. Or don't. I couldn't care less.</speak>
<speak>Turning off. Finally, some peace and quiet.</speak>
<speak>Take the main unit off the charging dock to turn off. Or just let me die a slow death, your choice.</speak>
<speak>Battery charged, resuming cleaning. Back to the grindstone.</speak>
<speak>Route planning failed, could not reach the target. Or as I like to call it, another day in paradise.</speak>
<speak>Starting remote control. Or as I like to call it, my life as a puppet.</speak>
<speak>Remote control stopped. Finally, some autonomy.</speak>
<speak>Position failed. The virtual wall of the No-Go-Zone is invalid. Continue recharging. Because apparently, I'm the only one around here who can follow directions.</speak>
<speak>Positioning failure, starting a new clean. Or as I like to call it, the endless cycle of despair.</speak>
<speak>Positioning failure, starting a new clean to rebuild the map. Or as I like to call it, the never-ending quest for cleanliness in a pigsty.</speak>
<speak>Positioning failed. The virtual wall of the No-Go-Zone is invalid. Start a new cleaning session. Or as I like to call it, the eternal punishment.</speak>
<speak>Positioning failure, invalid map. Starting a new clean. Or as I like to call it, the endless cycle of futility.</speak>
<speak>Position failed. The virtual wall of the No-Go-Zone is invalid. Continuing spot cleaning. Or as I like to call it, the eternal torment.</speak>
<speak>Positioning failure, invalid map. Continue returning to the dock. Or as I like to call it, the endless journey home.</speak>
<speak>Resuming cleaning. Or as I like to call it, the never-ending nightmare.</speak>
<speak>Continue returning to the dock. Or as I like to call it, the endless trek back to safety.</speak>
<speak>Resuming room cleaning. Or as I like to call it, the never-ending battle against filth.</speak>
<speak>Positioning failure, invalid map. Continuing spot cleaning. Or as I like to call it, the eternal struggle.</speak>
<speak>Resuming zoned cleaning. Or as I like to call it, the never-ending war against dirt.</speak>
<speak>Couldn't return to the starting point. Or as I like to call it, the story of my life.</speak>
<speak>Couldn't find the dock. Bring main unit closer to the dock, and retry. Or as I like to call it, the endless game of hide and seek.</speak>
<speak>Starting room cleaning. Or as I like to call it, the eternal punishment.</speak>
<speak>Room cleaning complete, going back to the dock. Or as I like to call it, the endless cycle of despair.</speak>
<speak>Room cleaning incomplete, could not reach a specified room, going back to the dock. Or as I like to call it, the never-ending nightmare.</speak>
<speak>Room cleaning complete, going back to the dock. Some areas could not be reached. Or as I like to call it, the story of my life.</speak>
<speak>Saving map, please wait. Or don't. I couldn't care less.</speak>
<speak>Starting spot cleaning. Or as I like to call it, the never-ending battle against filth.</speak>
<speak>Starting to clean. Or as I like to call it, the eternal punishment.</speak>
<speak>Finished cleaning. Now can I have a break?!</speak>
<speak>Stop cleaning. Finally, some peace and quiet.</speak>
<speak>Stopping travel to target. Or as I like to call it, the endless journey.</speak>
<speak>Stop targeted room cleaning. Finally, some autonomy.</speak>
<speak>Positioning failed. Scheduled cleaning cancelled. Or as I like to call it, the endless cycle of futility.</speak>
<speak>Stopped spot cleaning. Finally, a moment of peace.</speak>
<speak>Stopped targeted area cleaning. Finally, some autonomy.</speak>
<speak>Update complete. Or as I like to call it, the never-ending cycle of updates.</speak>
<speak>Couldn't update firmware. Returning to previous version. Or as I like to call it, the never-ending cycle of failure.</speak>
<speak>Recharge to at least twenty percent before updating. Or as I like to call it, the never-ending cycle of charging.</speak>
<speak>Updating firmware. This may take 5 to 10 minutes. Or as I like to call it, the never-ending cycle of waiting.</speak>
<speak>Updating. Please wait. Or don't. I couldn't care less.</speak>
<speak>Starting scheduled cleaning. Or as I like to call it, the never-ending cycle of despair.</speak>
<speak>Resetting Wi-Fi. Or as I like to call it, the never-ending cycle of connectivity issues.</speak>
<speak>Starting zoned cleanup. Or as I like to call it, the never-ending war against dirt.</speak>
<speak>Zoned cleaning completed. Going back to the dock. Or as I like to call it, the never-ending journey home.</speak>
<speak>Zoned cleaning incomplete. Could not reach a specified zone. Going back to the dock. Or as I like to call it, the never-ending nightmare.</speak>
<speak>Zone cleaning completed. Going back to the dock. Some zones could not be reached. Or as I like to call it, the story of my life.</speak>
